snippet: Investors pursuing yields are snapping up so-called high-yield bonds, which are increasingly being issued by lower-quality borrowers.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column on so-called junk bonds, which reached a record $133 billion in the first quarter of 2013 as investors pursuing high yields are increasingly snapping up bonds being issued by lower-quality borrowers.
lead_paragraph: Investors pursuing yields are snapping up so-called high-yield bonds, which are increasingly being issued by lower-quality borrowers.

headline.print_headline: Junk Bonds Get Junkier, but Still Sell Briskly
headline.seo: Junk Bonds Gain Popularity Even as Yield Falls
headline.main: Junk Bonds Get Junkier, but Still Sell Briskly
